site_name: TURK HAVA YOLLARI AO TURKISH AIRLINES - JFK - John F. Kennedy International Airp

citations.narrative:
This carrier's registration expired on 5/6/2025. On May 15th, 2025, 1 female neutered, labrador retriever (microchip #
900233002780145) arrived at John F. Kennedy International Airport (Queens, New York) from Istanbul Airport (Istanbul,
Turkey) on Turkish Airlines (Flight TK11).
Proper registration is essential to track the transportation of animals and to ensure compliance with all appropriate
regulations and guidelines. Each carrier or handler who handles covered animals shall ensure they are registered with
USDA by completing and filing a properly executed form and that the registration is updated every 3 years by the
completion and filing of a new registration form.

On May 15th, 2025, 1 female neutered, labrador retriever (microchip # 900233002780145) arrived at John F. Kennedy
International Airport (Queens, New York) from Istanbul Airport (Istanbul, Turkey) on Turkish Airlines (Flight TK11).
CDC representatives noted the following upon arrival:
- The dog arrived with a bandaged wound on her right front paw.
- The wound appeared to be an infected surgical site.
- The dog displayed a resistance to put weight on the same paw.
No documentation was present to indicate the dog was entering the United States for veterinary care. Failure to prevent
the transport of sick or injured animals may lead to worsening of the animal’s condition. Dogs that are ill, injured or in
physical distress, must not be transported in commerce, except to receive veterinary care for the condition, for the comfort
and well-being of the animals.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with airline representatives.
n
